info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 8:48PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, southern Teton, west central Chouteau and northern Cascade Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 848 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds associated with shower activity over northern Lewis and Clark County and southern Teton County, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Augusta, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Power, Pishkun Reservoir, Eden, Stockett, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Ulm, Simms, Malmstrom Afb, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake and Tracy. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 249 and 314. Highway 200 between mile markers 98 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 12 and 64. Highway 87 between mile markers 4 and 8. Highway 89 near mile marker 64, between mile markers 9 and 42, and between mile markers 85 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
